TI 3RD HARMONIC ELECTRON-CYCLOTRON HEATING OF OVERDENSE PLASMAS IN
   HELIOTRON DR
SO NUCLEAR FUSION
LA English
DT Article
ID STELLARATOR EXPANSION; OBLIQUE-INCIDENCE; MODE-CONVERSION; HELICAL
   SYSTEMS; DENSITY; EQUILIBRIUM; PENETRATION; FREQUENCIES; PROFILE; RANGE
AB Third harmonic electron cyclotron heating has been experimentally studied in Heliotron DR (R = 90 cm, aBAR congruent-to 7 cm) by using a 28 GHz, 200 kW gyrotron.  When the line averaged electron density nBAR(e) exceeds a certain critical value, n(e, crit) approximately 0.5 x 10(13)/cm3, the absorption power increases rapidly and plasmas are substantially heated as long as the third harmonic resonant layer is located within the last closed magnetic surface.  On the other hand, heating of the bulk plasma is not effective at lower density, nBAR(e) < n(e, crit), although strong hard X-rays are emitted, which suggests the generation of high energy electrons.  In the high density regime, the central plasma region is heated even when the electron density is much higher than the cut-off value of the O-mode (overdense plasma), almost independent of the location of resonant layers.  It is found that overdense plasmas produced by third harmonic heating have basically the same characteristics as plasmas produced by second harmonic heating in Heliotron DR.  The absorption of the electron Bernstein wave generated via a mode conversion process is considered to be the heating mechanism of overdense plasmas at the third harmonic resonance.
RP YANAGI, N (reprint author), KYOTO UNIV,PLASMA PHYS LAB,KYOTO 606,JAPAN.

TI EXPERIMENTAL-STUDY OF COLOR DEGREE OF FREEDOM OF GLUONS IN E+E-
   ANNIHILATION AT SQUARE-ROOT-S AROUND 60 GEV
SO PHYSICAL REVIEW LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
ID 3-GLUON VERTEX; 4-JET EVENTS; QCD
AB We have studied four-jet angular distributions using data collected with the VENUS detector at the KEK e+e- collider TRISTAN at c.m. energies between 54 and 64 GeV.  The observed angular distributions are consistent with QCD, but are inconsistent with the Abelian gluon model at the 5% significance level.  We have further obtained 95%-confidence experimental bounds on the fundamental parameters of the SU(N(c)) local color symmetry.

TI SURFACE FRACTAL DIMENSION OF MICROPOROUS CARBON-FIBERS BY NITROGEN
   ADSORPTION
SO JOURNAL OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY-FARADAY TRANSACTIONS
LA English
DT Article
ID ANGLE X-RAY; PHYSICAL ADSORPTION; SCATTERING; FIBERS; PARTICLES; NO
AB The surface fractal dimension of three kinds of microporous carbon fibre has been determined from adsorption data of organic molecules of different molecular sizes (MAI method), by detailed N2 adsorption isotherms with the aid of the recently proposed Avnir-Jaroniec theory (AJ method) and by small-angle X-ray scattering (SAXS).  The application conditions of the AJ theory to the N2 adsorption isotherm have been examined.  The surface fractal dimension by the AJ method depends on the range of the fractional filling.  In the fractional filling range ca. 0.8-1.0 the value of the surface fractal dimension is ca. 2.6-2.7 and nearly constant; therefore, this range of adsorption data is suggested for evaluating the fractal dimension by the AJ method.  The surface fractal dimension by the MAI method was 2.3-3.0 and that by SAXS was 2.6-2.8 in dry air.  Thus the AJ method, which uses a single adsorption isotherm, can give a reasonable value of the surface fractal dimension, similar to those given by MAI and SAXS methods.

TI SMALL-ANGLE X-RAY-SCATTERING STUDY OF CYTOCHROME-OXIDASE FROM BEEF-HEART
   AND ITS COMPLEX WITH CYTOCHROME-C USING CONTRAST VARIATION METHOD
SO BULLETIN OF THE CHEMICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
LA English
DT Article
AB The structure of cytochrome oxidase from beef heart and its complex with cytochrome c were investigated in solution by X-ray small-angle scattering.  The contrast variation method was applied to the present analysis.  The radii of gyration and maximum dimensions were estimated to be 54 and 165 angstrom for the cytochrome oxidase and 56 and 165 angstrom for the complex, respectively.  A model of the dimer was constructed so as to interpret the X-ray scattering data well.  It was concluded that cytochrome c is bound to the hydrophilic surface of the enzyme near the edges of the ellipsoidal molecule, and that detergent molecules exist on the surface of the central parts of the enzyme.

LA English

AB With ferrocenyl octadecyl sulfide, stable monolayers on water surface can be obtained by mixing with stearic acid or by oxidizing to the sulfone derivative and can be easily deposited on solid supports to form well-organized LB films, as confirmed by polarized IR spectra and X-ray diffraction. TI APPROXIMATE SOLUTION OF THE SAHA EQUATION - TEMPERATURE AS AN EXPLICIT
   FUNCTION OF PARTICLE DENSITIES
SO CONTRIBUTIONS TO PLASMA PHYSICS
LA English
DT Article
AB The Saha equation for a plasma in thermodynamic equilibrium (TE) is approximately solved to give the temperature as an explicit function of population densities.  It is shown that the derived expressions for the Saha temperature are valid approximations to the exact solution.  An application of the approximate temperature to the calculation of TE plasma parameters is also described.

TI SYNTHESIS AND THERMAL-PROPERTIES OF NOVEL THERMOTROPIC
   AROMATIC-ALIPHATIC HOMOPOLYAMIDES AND COPOLYAMIDES
SO EUROPEAN POLYMER JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
ID LIQUID-CRYSTAL POLYMERS; MAIN-CHAIN; POLYAMIDES
AB Novel high molecular-weight aromatic-aliphatic homo- and copolyamides were synthesized in high yields by direct polycondensation of 2,3,5,6-tetramethyl-1,4-diaminobenzene and m-phenylene diamine with eicosanedioic acid. The polymers were characterized by elemental analyses, FT-IR and carbon-13 NMR spectra. Their thermal properties were evaluated by means of TGA and DSC. Mesomorphic behaviour was checked by observation of optical texture with a polarizing microscope. m-Phenylene unit-rich polymers exhibit well-defined thermotropic liquid crystalline phases and have lower glass-transition temperatures.

AU SATO, M
   OZAWA, S

AF SATO, M

   OGINO, Y
TI EFFECTS OF PRESSURE UPON AFFINITIES OF SUBSITES OF AN IMMOBILIZED
   GLUCOAMYLASE
SO NIPPON KAGAKU KAISHI
LA Japanese
DT Article
ID GLUCONOLACTONE; INHIBITION; SUBSTRATE
AB The pressure dependence of the substrate affinity of the subsite-1 of an immobilized glucoamylase was studied, using the hydrolysis of maltose as a test reaction and gluconolatone as an inhibitor.  The pressure dependences of the substrate affinities of the subsite-2, and subsite-3 were also studied, using hydrolyses of maltose and maltotriose as test reactions.  The pressure range used was 0.1 approximately 98 MPa and the temperature was 25 +/- 0.1-degrees-C.  The inhibition effect of gluconolactone upon the maltose hydrolysis was enhanced by pressure (Table 1), giving a volume change of -14 +/- 4 cm3.mol-1 for the subsite-1-inhibitor interaction.  A hydrogen-bond formation between the subsite and a gluconolactone molecule would be responsible for the volume change observed.  The affinity (A2) of the subsite-2 and the affinity (A3) of the subsite-3 were 21.9 and 5.6 kJ.mol-1, respectively.  These values were almost unchanged by the increase in the applied pressure (Table 2).
RP SATO, M (reprint author), TOHOKU UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT MOLEC CHEM & ENGN,AOBA KU,SENDAI,MIYAGI 980,JAPAN.

TI HEATING AND CONFINEMENT CHARACTERISTICS OF 2ND HARMONIC HEATING IN THE
   ION-CYCLOTRON RANGE OF FREQUENCIES ON THE JT-60 TOKAMAK
SO NUCLEAR FUSION
LA English
DT Article
ID ICRF WAVES; SYSTEM; PLASMAS
AB Results are presented of the second harmonic heating experiments in the ion cyclotron range of frequencies (ICRF) on JT-60.  Heating and confinement characteristics are investigated by using the hydrogen second harmonic (H-majority 2-omega-cH) scheme and the hydrogen minority second harmonic (H-minority 2-omega-cH) scheme (n(H)/n(He) almost-equal-to 0.1) in two toroidal phasing modes of antenna currents, in phase ((0, 0)) and out of phase ((pi, 0)), at P(IC) less-than-or-equal-to 3 MW, nBAR(e) = (1.3-6.6) x 10(19) m-3 and I(P) = 1-2.4 MA.  Efficient plasma heating has been demonstrated in both heating schemes.  Intense non-Maxwellian ion tails are observed at low density.  Sawtooth oscillations with an enhanced period in the electron temperature are found over a wide range of electron densities.  The incremental energy confinement time, tau-E(inc), for (pi, 0) phasing is larger than for (0, 0) phasing, irrespective of the heating scheme.  In particular, H-minority 2-omega-cH heating with (pi, 0) phasing shows excellent plasma heating with tau-E(inc) almost-equal-to 100-120 ms, which is larger than that of neutral beam injection (NBI) heating by a factor of about two.  Different dependences of tau-E(inc) on I(p) are obtained in the two heating schemes.  The (0, 0) phasing data of tau-E(inc) in H-majority 2-omega-cH heating increase with I(p) up to 1.9 MA, while the (pi, 0) phasing data in H-minority 2-omega-cH heating are almost constant with I(p) up to 2.4 MA.  The global energy confinement shows an L-mode behaviour.  The energy confinement time for H-minority 2-omega-cH heating at high density agrees well with the Shimomura-Odajima scaling.
RP FUJII, T (reprint author), JAPAN ATOM ENERGY RES INST,NAKA FUS RES ESTAB,NAKA,IBARAKI,JAPAN.

TI CONFIGURATIONAL FEATURE OF ELECTROCHEMICALLY-PREPARED
   POLY(3-DODECYLTHIOPHENE)
SO POLYMER COMMUNICATIONS
LA English
DT Article
DE POLY(3-DODECYLTHIOPHENE); NMR; NOE; DYAD AND TRIAD SEQUENCES; DEGREE OF
   POLYMERIZATION
ID CONDUCTING POLYTHIOPHENE
AB The n.m.r. spectra of poly(3-dodecylthiophene) (PDDT) show that the resonances of 4-protons on the successive 2,5-linked thiophene ring are resolved into four peaks due to different traid sequences.  The configurational structures were determined by the analyses of H-1-H-1 nuclear Overhauser effect spectra and H-1 nuclear Overhauser effect difference spectroscopy of PDDT.  A pair of doublet peaks at delta = 6.93 and 7.16 are assigned to the 4- and 5-protons on the terminal 2-substituted thiophene rings and peaks due to the other terminal units were not detected.  The relative intensity of the doublet peaks suggests that the degree of polymerization of PDDT is about 170.
RP SATO, M (reprint author), RES INST POLYMERS & TEXT,POLYMERS & TEXT INST,HIGASHI 1-1-4,TSUKUBA,IBARAKI 305,JAPAN.

TI ROLE OF CATALYSTS ON ELECTRODE ACTIVITY IN OXYGEN DIFFUSION HYBRID
   POLYMER ELECTRODE
SO POLYMER JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
DE HYBRID POLYMER FILM; GAS DIFFUSION ELECTRODE; ELECTROCHEMICAL OXYGEN
   REDUCTION; POLYPYRROLE; METAL PHTHALOCYANINE; POLY(VINYL CHLORIDE);
   TRITIUM TRACER METHOD
ID CARBON CARRIERS; WETTABILITY
AB A film type of gas diffusion hybrid polymer (GDHP) electrode with about 100-mu-m in thickness was prepared by the electrochemical polymerization of pyrrole in the poly(vinyl chloride) binder polymer film which contained a metal-phthalocyanine (M-Pc; M:  Co, Cu, or Pd) crystal as a catalyst.  The role of the catalyst on the oxygen reduction reaction in the GDHP electrode was investigated.  There were some correlations between the electrode activity and the dispersion state of the crystalline particles of the catalyst.  The GDHP electrode with Co-Pc catalyst gave a high activity, and was stable for a long time working.  An optimum amount of Co-Pc catalyst for the electrode activity was found to exist around 50wt% to the amount of polymer matrix (binder polymer and catalyst).  By using a tritium tracer method, it was also found that the permeability of water vapor through the electrode took a maximum value when using the electrode with the optimum amount of Co-Pc catalyst.  The reaction mechanism of this film type GDHP electrode was considered on the basis of the behaviour of the reaction species.
C1 NIIGATA UNIV,FAC ENGN,DEPT APPL CHEM,NIIGATA 95021,JAPAN.

TI APPLICATION OF CONVERGENCE CONFINEMENT ANALYSIS TO THE STUDY OF
   PRECEDING DISPLACEMENT OF A SQUEEZING ROCK TUNNEL
SO ROCK MECHANICS AND ROCK ENGINEERING
LA English
DT Article
AB This paper deals with a study on the geomechanical behavior of the rock mass around the tunnel.  The Convergence Confinement Analysis is one of the most appropriate way to estimate this behavior.  Elasto-plastic models proposed by Hoek and Brown, Egger and Kastner were adopted in this study.
   Measurements of the preceding displacement were performed in a road tunnel in Japan, the geology of which is Neogene squeezing mudstone.  The measured data was compared with the results of Convergence Confinement Analysis.
   The preceding displacement was about 40% against the upper bench face converged displacement and 17% against the final converged displacement.  Meanwhile, it increased drastically in lower bench excavation step.
   Back analysis was also executed to calculate the extension of the plastic zone of the rock mass, which was half of that estimated by Convergence Confinement Analysis in upper bench excavation step.  But, in lower bench excavation step, the results of the two analyses were very similar.  The support pressure and support stiffness were also calculated.
C1 JAPAN HIGHWAY PUBL CORP,TOKYO,JAPAN.
RP KITAGAWA, T (reprint author), NISHIMATSU CONSTRUCT CO LTD,TOKYO,JAPAN.

TI MICROWAVE SURFACE-RESISTANCE IN HIGH-TC SUPERCONDUCTING CERAMICS
SO SUPERCONDUCTOR SCIENCE & TECHNOLOGY
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT SATELLITE CONF TO THE 19TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON LOW TEMPERATURE PHYSICS
   : HIGH TEMPERATURE SUPERCONDUCTIVITY
CY AUG 13-15, 1990
CL CAMBRIDGE, ENGLAND
SP UNIV CAMBRIDGE, INTERDISCIPLINARY RES CTR SUPERCONDUCT
HO QUEENS COLL
ID Y1BA2CU3OY; DEPENDENCE
AB To clarify the origins of high microwave surface resistance R(s) in high-T(c) superconducting ceramics, the R(s) of different sized grain samples (from mu-m to mm) are measured as a function of temperature and magnetic field using the resonant cavity method.  It is demonstrated that the profiles of the R(s)-T and the R(s)-H curve strongly depend on the grain size.  Since T and H dependence becomes greater as the grain size is decreased, it is concluded that the R(s) of ceramics is mainly caused by weak-links located at the grain boundaries.
RP SATO, M (reprint author), NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,TRANSMISS SYST LABS,NAKA,IBARAKI 31911,JAPAN.

   YAMAGUCHI, N
   SHIMA, M
TI STUDY ON DIPOLE-MOMENTS OF MACROMOLECULES .2. DIPOLE-MOMENTS OF
   PARA-METHOXYTOLUENE, PARA-BROMOETHYLBENZENE AND PARA-BROMOTOLUENE AS
   STRUCTURAL UNITS OF POLY(PARA-METHOXYSTYRENE) AND
   POLY(PARA-BROMOSTYRENE)
SO POLYMER JOURNAL
LA English
DT Article
DE DIPOLE MOMENT; DIELECTRIC CONSTANT; PARA-METHOXYTOLUENE;
   PARA-BROMOETHYLBENZENE; PARA-BROMOTOLUENE; SOLVENT EFFECT
ID EXCLUDED-VOLUME
AB The dipole moments of p-methoxytoluene (p-MeOTol), p-bromoethylbenzene (p-BrEtBz), and p-bromotoluene (p-BrTol) corresponding to structural units of poly(p-methoxystyrene) and poly(p-bromostyrene) were determined from dielectric constant and density measurements on their benzene, p-dioxane, and toluene solutions over the temperature range of 25-55-degrees-C, and we examined the effects of solvent and temperature on the dipole moments.  It was found that the observed dipole moment mu-0 is sensitive to the solvent and gives a larger value when the dielectric constant of solvent used for measurements is smaller.  The dipole moments obtained for p-MeOTol at 25-degrees-C were 1.304 D in p-dioxane, 1.257 D in benzene and 1.204 D in toluene, and the mu-0 values of p-BrEtBz were 2.086 D in p-dioxane and 2.007 D in benzene.  The results were interpreted on the basis of Higashi's theory.  Temperature dependence of the dipole moments was also observed.  The observed values of mu-0 obtained for p-MeOTol and p-BrEtBz and p-BrTol slightly increased with increasing temperature, which is explainable as due to the change of dielectric constant of solvent with temperature.
RP SATO, M (reprint author), TOKYO WOMENS CHRISTIAN UNIV,DEPT CHEM,ZEMPUKUJI,SUGINAMI KU,TOKYO 167,JAPAN.

TI LOW SURFACE-RESISTANCE OF SCREEN-PRINTED YBA2CU3O7-X THICK-FILMS
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 2-LETTERS
LA English
DT Article
AB This letter describes the surface resistance of YBa2Cu3O7-x thick films which are screen printed on Ag-coated Y2O3-stabilized ZrO2 substrates. The surface resistance decreases with decreasing YBa2Cu3O7-x film thickness.  The 7-mu-m-thick film shows the lowest surface resistances (8.2 m-OMEGA at 17 GHz and 48 m-OMEGA at 50 GHz at liquid nitrogen temperature) which are lower than those of pure Cu.  These markedly low surface resistances are attributed to the enhanced growth and c-axis orientation of YBa2Cu3O7-x grains.
C1 NIPPON TELEGRAPH & TEL PUBL CORP,TRANSMISS SYST LABS,TOKAI,IBARAKI 31911,JAPAN.

TI MAGNETIC PHASE-DIAGRAM OF (FE,CO) 7S8 AND (MN,TI)SB
SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
AB Magnetic, X-ray and NMR measurements have been made on (Fe,Co)7S8 and (Mn,Ti)Sb.  Around the magnetic critical concentration, the simple disappearance of ferrimagnetism in the former makes a marked contrast with spin glass-like behavior in the latter.  These results are discussed with a correlation between magnetism and lattice spacing c in NiAs-type compounds.

TI 2-SPIN SUPEREXCHANGE AND 4-SPIN CYCLIC EXCHANGE INTERACTIONS IN HIGH-TC

SO JOURNAL OF MAGNETISM AND MAGNETIC MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 25TH CONF OF THE YAMADA SCIENCE FOUNDATION : MAGNETIC PHASE TRANSITIONS
CY APR 13-16, 1990
CL OSAKA, JAPAN
SP YAMADA SCI FDN
AB Raman spectra in the antiferromagnetic insulator phases of S = 1/2 high T(c) superconducting cuprates were compared with S = 1 La2NiO4.  The anomalous magnon spectra in cuprates suggest that the four-spin cyclic exchange interactions are very large.  The doped carriers in cuprates show non-Fermi liquid behavior.

TI ATOMIC-HYDROGEN BEHAVIOR IN HELIOTRON-E
SO JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 9TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON PLASMA-SURFACE INTERACTIONS IN CONTROLLED
   FUSION DEVICES ( PSI-9 )
CY MAY 21-25, 1990
CL BOURNEMOUTH, ENGLAND
SP JET JOINT UNDERTAKING, EURATOM
ID FLUORESCENCE SPECTROSCOPY; L-ALPHA; DENSITY; LASER; PROFILE; TOKAMAK;
   PLASMA; LINE
AB In order to understand atomic hydrogen behaviour and particle confinement properties in Heliotron E plasmas, techniques of laser induced fluorescence (LIF) have been extensively used, combined with measurements of absolute Balmer alpha emissions and density fluctuations.  The results revealed that for an average electron density nBAR(e) > 1.5 X 10(19) m-3, H-alpha fluorescence allowed the measurements of atomic hydrogen densities and yielded the recycled Franck-Condon neutrals (approximately 3 eV) to penetrate into core plasmas, whereas for nBAR(e) < 1.0 X 10(19) m-3, such measurements were perturbed by dissociative-excitation of H-2 molecules into the n = 2 state.  Also, the global confinement times showed a clear correlation with electron density fluctuations.

TI OXYGEN BEHAVIOR WITH A CARBON-TILED WALL IN HELIOTRON-E
SO JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 9TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON PLASMA-SURFACE INTERACTIONS IN CONTROLLED
   FUSION DEVICES ( PSI-9 )
CY MAY 21-25, 1990
CL BOURNEMOUTH, ENGLAND
SP JET JOINT UNDERTAKING, EURATOM
ID IMPURITY PRODUCTION; E DEVICE; TOKAMAKS; PLASMAS
AB A series of experiments was carried out with carbon tiles which covered all the divertor region, to which most of charged particles flow.  With this condition, oxygen radiation decreased shot by shot in the course of ECRH/helium discharges, while oxygen concentration became higher and higher with successive ECRH/hydrogen discharges.  This can be interpreted on the basis of a simple model, in which the hydrogen discharge causes migration of oxygen from the metal wall to the graphite divertor plates, and opposite migration from the divertor plates occurs in the helium discharge.

TI CONTROL OF THE MAGNETIC-CONFIGURATION IN THE HELIOTRON-E DEVICE
SO JOURNAL OF NUCLEAR MATERIALS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 9TH INTERNATIONAL CONF ON PLASMA-SURFACE INTERACTIONS IN CONTROLLED
   FUSION DEVICES ( PSI-9 )
CY MAY 21-25, 1990
CL BOURNEMOUTH, ENGLAND
SP JET JOINT UNDERTAKING, EURATOM
ID PLASMA
AB The magnetic configuration of the Heliotron-E device was controlled by adding auxiliary toroidal and/or vertical fields.  The changes in the plasma edge and the "divertor trace" were experimentally studied by using a double probe, calorimeters, a thermal Li-beam probe and a laser Thomson scattering system.  The variation of the vacuum configuration was also confirmed by the "stellarator diode method" with a small hot cathode.  It was found that the observed change in the edge region basically agreed with that expected from the line-tracing calculation.

   IIYOSHI, A
   MURAKAMI, M
   HOWE, HC
TI CONFINEMENT SCALING STUDIES OF RADIOFREQUENCY AND NEUTRAL BEAM HEATED
   CURRENTLESS HELIOTRON E PLASMAS
SO NUCLEAR FUSION
LA English
DT Article
ID THERMAL CONFINEMENT; ECRH PLASMA; ION; TOKAMAKS; STELLARATOR; TRANSPORT;
   MICROTURBULENCE; INJECTION; REGIME; TFTR
AB Parametric scaling studies of radiofrequency and neutral beam heated currentless Heliotron E plasmas have been performed.  The parametric local electron transport analyses show that the electron energy transport in electron cyclotron heating (ECH) plasmas is nearly of the same magnitude as the neoclassically predicted transport inside the 2/3 radius, while neutral beam injection (NBI) plasmas and plasmas in the ion cyclotron range of frequencies (ICRF) are dominated by anomalous electron transport in the entire region.  Scaling studies on the global energy confinement time reveal that ECH, NBI and ICRF plasmas obey approximately identical scalings that are characterized by continuous power degradation and favourable positive density dependence.  The global energy confinement time is thought to be affected by the anomalous transport in the peripheral plasma regions in the same way for ECH, NBI and ICRF plasmas although the core plasma properties - such as local electron transport - seem to be different for the individual plasmas.

TI EQUIVALENT-CIRCUIT OF PIEZOELECTRIC TRANSDUCERS WITH SPATIALLY
   NONUNIFORM PROPERTIES
SO JAPANESE JOURNAL OF APPLIED PHYSICS PART 1-REGULAR PAPERS SHORT NOTES &
   REVIEW PAPERS
LA English
DT Article; Proceedings Paper
CT 10TH SYMP ON ULTRASONIC ELECTRONICS ( USE 89 )
CY NOV 07-09, 1989
CL TOKYO, JAPAN
SP JAPAN SOC APPL PHYS, INST ELECTR INFORMAT & COMMUN ENGINEERS JAPAN, INST ELECT ENGINEERS JAPAN, INST TELEVIS ENGINEERS JAPAN, ACOUST SOC JAPAN, JAPAN SOC ULTRASON MED, JAPAN SOC NON DESTRUCT INSPECT, MARINE ACOUST SOC JAPAN, IEEE, ULTRASON FERROELECT & FREQUENCY CONTROL SOC, TOKYO CHAPTER
HO TOKYO INST TECHNOL
AB The paper shows how transducers having nonuniform properties may be represented by an equivalent circuit.  The circuit is constructed by cascade connection of many fundamental equivalent circuits made up of small transmission lines and lumped elements.  Under the condition that wavelengths are much longer than the small transmission lines, the fundamental circuit approximates the constitutive relation equations of a small section of the transducer.  Formulation for transient calculation is performed easily by Bergeron's method.  The numerical result proved to be in good agreement with the analytical solution.
C1 HOKKAIDO UNIV,FAC ENGN,SAPPORO,HOKKAIDO 060,JAPAN.

   SATO M, 1988, JPN J APPL PHYS 1, V27, P102

PT J
AU Henrard, J
   Sato, M
AF Henrard, Jacques
   Sato, Massae
TI THE ORIGIN OF CHAOTIC BEHAVIOUR IN THE MIRANDA-UMBRIEL 3: 1 RESONANCES
SO CELESTIAL MECHANICS & DYNAMICAL ASTRONOMY
LA English
DT Article
DE Resonance; chaotic motion; perturbation theory; tidal evolution; Miranda
AB We have investigated the pericentric resonances through which Miranda and Umbriel are believed to have passed when, due to tidal evolution, their orbital mean motions reached a 3 : 1 commensurability. Our investigation is based upon a perturbative treatment. The predictions of this theory are in good agreement with the results of numerical integrations concerning both the extend of the chaotic layers generated by the separatrices of the primary resonances and the location of the secondary resonances. The effect of tidal evolution is discussed on the bases of the adiatatic invariant theory and its extension to separatrix crossing. We recover qualitatively the mean features of the numerical experiments of Tittermore and Wisdom (1988-1989), Dermott et al (1988) and Malhotra and Dermott (1989).
C1 Fac Univ Notre Dame Paix, Dept Math, B-5000 Namur, Belgium.
   Univ Sao Paulo, Inst Astron & Geofis, BR-05508 Sao Paulo, Brazil.
RP Henrard, J (reprint author), Fac Univ Notre Dame Paix, Dept Math, 8 Rempart de la Vierge, B-5000 Namur, Belgium.
FU Brasilian Science Fundation (CNPq); Belgian Science Fundation (FNRS)
FX Most of this research was conducted in October and December 1988 while
   the second author was visiting the University of Namur. This visit was
   funded by the Brasilian Science Fundation (CNPq) and the Belgian Science
   Fundation (FNRS).
